title: Bulk Buy Discount on Firetecs - Order sent into Firetec

posts.content:
Had a few enquiries recently so guess there's a few 'new' buses out there being finished off.

Anyone want in on a bulk buy for collection at the AGM. Discount depends on the eventual number of units included in on the purchase. So to keep things simple, will run it like previous bulk buys. Everyone pays normal price then get the appropriate discount refunded once the deal is closed. From memory I think the refunds / discount was around Â£50 per unit.

http://www.vwjim.co.uk/ourshop/cat_3349 ... stems.html

Hi
Would like to Have one of these as having expensive new engine fitted in June, would like the Automatic supression system with the chafeguard & auxilary switch, please let me know if this is confirmed on the bulk buy.
Many thanks for your time in doing this and pm me any probs.

Ron
Andover Hants

No problem.

Okay to start it off.

Ron Smith - Chafe & Aux Switch. (Standard or Underfloor fitting position?)

Hi Jim,

Can you post a pic of the two types of installation position please ?

Cheers,

Phil.

Hi Jim

How much are the ones with single extinguisher plus heat sensitive 'coil' that goes off in engine bay when fire occurs please ?

Ta

Hi Jim
Not sure which is the best and most effective / standard or underfloor so will need to see what comes back on the forum as to what other recommend as there is only one guy in our club who has a firetech and his is the standard.

What would you recommend ???

Thanks for your help

Ron

Andover Hants

Normal prices as here;

http://www.vwjim.co.uk/ourshop/cat_3349 ... stems.html

minus the discount that is eventually due.

Standard bottles can either lay flat on the bed of the engine bay so the hose comes out at the 12o'clock position or stand vertical

This is how mine sits as underfloor wasn't available at the time / my engine was out so it was easy to get it back there.
Underfloor versions hang from the underside of the engine bay roof so the hose comes out at the 3o'clock position, or can also mount vertically.
All version can mount vertically.

RON SMITH wrote:
Hi Jim
Not sure which is the best and most effective / standard or underfloor so will need to see what comes back on the forum as to what other recommend as there is only one guy in our club who has a firetech and his is the standard.

What would you recommend ???

Thanks for your help

Ron

Andover Hants


Ron, I now nearly always install the underfloor versions, as they get the bottle up out of the way for regular servicing. Performance wise, makes no difference.

Vertical installations are okay, but you can't see the gauge as easy as a horizontal install.
Hi Jim, I could be interested in one of these. What's the auxliary switch for?

Hi Jim

Yes the underfloor system looks just what i would like so can confirm this now to my order.

Many thanks for your time and let me know when you would require payment and how.

Ta

Ron
Hi can you put me down for a basic one thanks steve

ferkh10 wrote:
Hi Jim, I could be interested in one of these. What's the auxliary switch for?


So you can run an LED on your dash to warn you if the system has gone off / system all okay.
